title: Chord: add2 in B (Shape: E)

## Chord: add2 in B (Shape: E)

### Brief Presentation
The add2 chord, also known as the add9 chord, is a triad with the addition of the second note of the scale. In the key of B, the add2 chord would consist of the notes B, C#, D#, F#, and G#.

### Notes and Intervals
- Root: B
- Major 2nd: C#
- Major 3rd: D#
- Perfect 5th: F#
- Major 6th (added 2): G#

### Musical Flavor and Genre
The add2 chord in B has a dreamy and ethereal sound due to the added major 2nd interval. This chord is often used in pop, folk, and indie music to create a sense of warmth and color in compositions.

### Songs
1. **"Babylon" by David Gray**: This song features the add2 chord in B during the chorus, adding a touch of melancholy and depth to the harmonic progression.
   
2. **"Yellow" by Coldplay**: The intro and verses of this iconic song use the add2 chord in B, contributing to the uplifting and emotional atmosphere of the track.
   
3. **"Ho Hey" by The Lumineers**: The add2 chord in B can be heard throughout this folk-pop hit, enhancing the rustic and organic feel of the song.
